location: 5 km west of Cannes, French Riviera

primary: French DGAC (Direction Générale de l'Aviation Civile)

operational_hours.notes: Seasonal variations: Summer (May 16-Sept 17) 08:00 LT-sunset+30min or 18:00 LT latest. Winter 07:00-19:00 UTC. Strict night curfew with NO exceptions for night operations. Control tower operates 08:00-20:00 LT seasonal.

slot_requirements.slot_availability_typical: Generally available except during special events
slot_requirements.notes: Slots required for all operations, especially during Cannes Film Festival and Monaco Grand Prix period. Early coordination recommended through handling agents (SKY VALET primary). Events can cause significant congestion.

weather_vulnerability.seasonal_risk_periods: October-November (occasional autumn storms), Mediterranean heat in summer
weather_vulnerability.notes: Mediterranean climate with VFR conditions typical. Fog extremely rare. Wind generally not limiting factor. Occasional coastal thunderstorms October-November. Overall excellent weather reliability.

runway_specifications.weight_restrictions: MTOM 5.7 tons on Runway 04/22; larger aircraft use Runway 17/35
runway_specifications.notes: Aircraft exceeding 35 tonnes (turbojets) or 22 tonnes (propeller) must use Nice Côte d'Azur (LFPG). Designed for business and light commercial aviation.

crew_requirements.minimum_pilot_hours: Not specified; EASA Part-FCL requirements apply
crew_requirements.notes: Standard EASA licensing requirements (Regulation 1178/2011). No special qualifications required. Mandatory pilot web briefing required before operations at Cannes.

handling_complexity.notes: Two main FBOs: SKY VALET (primary) and G-OPS. Fuel available (JET A-1, AVGAS). EU/Schengen streamlined processing. VIP-level services standard. Weekend/evening surcharges apply. Handling agents require advance notification.

congestion_metrics.atc_delays_frequency: Rare except during Cannes Film Festival/Grand Prix
congestion_metrics.notes: Generally efficient operations. Film Festival (May) and Monaco Grand Prix period (May 20-23) cause significant congestion multiplier. Summer tourism increases traffic 2.5x. Otherwise smooth operations.

permits_and_clearances.notes: No formal permits required for EU-registered aircraft. Non-EU operators should arrange through handling agent. Mandatory briefing at Cannes.aeroport.fr/en required.

noise_restrictions.chapter_requirements: No specific Chapter designation; French noise regulations apply
noise_restrictions.notes: No strict noise restrictions. Runway selection accommodates coastal wind patterns. Limited residential areas around airport. Noise complaints minimal.

infrastructure_reliability.notes: Modern facilities with good reliability record. Backup power systems available. Rarely requires closure. Well-maintained infrastructure for business aviation.

security_requirements.enhanced_security_periods: During Cannes Film Festival and major events
security_requirements.notes: Schengen airport with EU security standards. Streamlined processing for regular business aviation. Enhanced security during festival/Grand Prix. VIP services standard for executive aviation.

seasonal_factors.high_season_months: May (Film Festival), June-August (summer tourism), September-October (yacht shows)
seasonal_factors.holiday_peak_dates: May (Cannes Film Festival), July-August (European holidays), September (Yacht Shows)
seasonal_factors.notes: May peak season dominated by Film Festival and Grand Prix. Summer steady tourism. Weather excellent year-round with no winter weather delays. Mediterranean climate provides consistent operations.

alternate_airport_proximity.notes: Nice is primary alternate for larger aircraft (>35 tons). Antibes nearby for smaller aircraft. Multiple options within reasonable distance.

payment_and_fees.notes: Airport charges structured per light (<4 tons) and heavy aircraft. Handling fees set annually (2023-2025 rates documented). Weekend surcharges apply. EU-regulated fee structure.

primary_risk_factors: Strict night curfew (NO night operations allowed)
Limited runway capacity for heavy aircraft
Seasonal tourism traffic spikes (2.5x multiplier May-August)
advantages: Excellent Mediterranean climate, minimal weather disruptions
Short taxi times and efficient turnarounds
operational_summary.key_operational_considerations: Cannes is an excellent choice for business aviation when daytime operations are feasible. Strict night curfew is critical constraint—no flexibility. Must coordinate advance for Film Festival (May) and Grand Prix period (May 20-23). Weather is exceptionally reliable year-round. VIP-level ground services and efficient handling are standard. Aircraft over 35 tons must use Nice. Advance handling coordination recommended, especially during peak seasons.
